start: ^ Hello? Did you make it *skrr* … *skrrr* okay?
^ *skrr* reception is shot *whine skrr* storm coming…
^ All right. I need to find a spot with better reception.
^<color=green>[TUTORIAL: Walk around by clicking the mouse until you find a spot where the signal is clear.]</color>
^<color=green>[TUTORIAL: Then open the inventory (lower left) and click on the Walkie-Talkie to use it!.]

b: ^ You had me worried. I had to come haul your blue-faced butt out of there myself.

EndGame: ^ I'm glad you decided to come back up.
^ We had a job to do and I did it.
^ Not worth to risk life and limb for.
^ No need to tell me twice. Let's get up in the air. I've been promised gruel!

b: ^[Cannot consume item - not enough in Player inventory!]

GoToLevel1: ^ Back again. Gotta love the sunlight.
GoToLevel2: ^ I really don’t know why they restrict access to this level. It’s just more of the same.
GoToLevel3: ^ And the first super secret forbidden-by-the-employment-contract level is...an office. Underwhelming. I wanted mutant Mermen, and now nothing less will do.

b: ^ A computer terminal, I should probably take a look.
^ This is the computer for this level of the station.
^ A computer terminal, but it looks like the screen is dark. Probably non-functional.
^ Better to try my luck elsewhere.
^ Hmm, an old desk. But it looks like it's been cleared out.
^ Anything of interest was removed long ago.
^ Some paper. Could just be scrap, or it could be important.
^ An old tablet. There might be something useful on there, I should take a closer look.
^ A leftover device from the lab, looks like it still has a few sample vials in it.
^ A old piece of lab equiptment.
^ Seems to be some sort of storage tray, or maybe biometric device.
^ An old device, left over from the lab.
^ What the... are those mushrooms? Growing on the walls. Damn, hopefully there aren't any spores. There's no telling what kind of fungus might be growing down here.
^ Fungal mould on the walls, probably best to steer clear of it.
^ Wonder what this spigot was here for. I could try turning it...but no, that could end badly.
^ Still kinda want to turn it.
^ A notice of some kind. What does it say?
^ Strange. Someone pinned up a bunch of paper scraps and pictures. Are they just haphazard desk notes, or something more?
^ An anotomical poster showing some strange aquatic beast.
^ Ooh, a jellyfish. It looks so pretty in the dark water. Wouldn't want to go swimming with one though.
^ A jellyfish, glowing in the dark.
^ A Coelacanth! Wow, we must be a lot deeper than I realised.
^ A Coelacanth, drifting outside the window.
^ Come here pretty little fish, and say hello to Aunty Stevie.
^ The fish isn't in a conversational mood.
^ Oh look, a coral grow---no, are those bones? Shit. It's a ribcage fused with some sort of fleshy flower formation. How did it even get out there? Where did it come from? Who... did it come from?
^ I'd rather not inspect that too closely.
^ Is that something drifting out there in the water? A fish? Maybe seaweed? Or...no, let's just stick with the seaweed.
^ It's hard to make it out in the murky water, but it's probably nothing.
^ Is that...? Could that really be...?
^ It looks almost close enough to touch.

^ Woah, a moonpool. It's kind of terrifying to think about the fact that the entire ocean is waiting right there through that little opening. Like...right there. All you'd have to do is slip into the water, and you'd be outside.
^ Don't think about dark waters rising up to crush you. It's fine. It's just a regular pool opening out onto the bottom of the ocean.
^ All this glass, it seems so strange and fragile. One little breach and his whole Station would crumble like a cheap tin can.
^ If you stare at the window too long, it feels a bit like falling into a vortex. The ocean beyond seems endless.
^ Hope this old thing holds up.

Item23: ^ An old locker. Might have something useful in it.

b: ^ Looks like it's mainly mechanical. A breaker switch maybe.
^ Solved! On to the next level.
^ I need to get back in touch with Max first before I poke at this...
^ Great. All right. I’ll put the call through to head office and tell them we need clearance for Level 2.
^ And I’ll just waste oxygen down here until then.
^ There should be some extra canisters down there. Why don’t you fill up?
^ All right. Mosey on over to the elevator doors when you’re done taking in the sights.
^ Not much to do here. Still busted. I should head towards the elevator.
^ I bet Max would love this. Which reminds me...I better get back in touch.
^ Over here are some tubes. And over there, yep, some more tubes.
^ No way, I’ve got my feet up on the dash, catching up on some light reading of um, oceanic current patterns? It’s riveting. I feel like I’m on a mini-holiday.
^ Save me a seat would you.
^ If you want to join, you’d better hurry up. This storm is starting to threaten my dreams of suntanning on top of the plane.
^ Oh trust me, I can’t wait to get out of this suit.
^ Who says we have to wear these things all the time anyway.
^ I’m a glorified handyman, not a deep sea diver.
^ Rule 1: Thou shalt not enter a facility without the appropriate equipment.
^ Rule 2: Thou shalt not proceed below the upper levels of the facility without express permission from Head Office.
^ Shut up and get back to work would you, I’m trying to read important literature over here.
^ I should stop dragging my feet.
^ Oh hey, wait! Jeesh, that was fast. Head office usually takes ages to respond to requests.
^ Looks like it. Head back to the elevator whenever you’re done.
^ Now just to wait. I might as well take in the sights...

Interact1: ^ Alright, I’m here. Let’s hope this one works.
^ Booting her up now. Are you seeing anything yet?
^ Sliding into the station system logs now. Why hello there my little beauty.
^ But the machinery responds better when you have a good bedside manner, every maintenance technician worth their salt knows that.
^ Yeah it is. They’re a bit like you, tough on the outside, but with a little bit of--
^ Yeah yeah, Casanova, we get the picture.
^ So tell me, what sweet nothings is the system whispering in your ear. Any clue as to why it's malfunctioning?.
^ Right now...It’s less a whisper, and more the screeching of a depressurising rift-breach. Seriously, ouch, this data is all over the place.
^ Do you think you can fix it? I’d hate to call in a clean-up crew. Those guys give me the creeps, too much rift radiation in their blood…
^ Never fear, Max the miracle worker is here. Just wait while I hard reset this baby, and we’ll be back at the Hub in time for dinner, you’ll see.
^ Just try and stop me. Lukewarm soup rations, and rehydrated crackers here I come.
^ Damn right I am. That’s why you keep me around.
^ To reset this, we need to flip the failsafe in the other oom.
^ Mosey on over there. We’ll have to do it kind-of simultaneously though.
^ Sure, we’ll do a one-two-three on the radio.
^ Unless the radio is on the fritz.

b: ^ It's some kind of breaker or something. Won't help Max get into the station mainframe though.
^ No point coming back here until I've gotten back in contact with Max.
^ I got it, I got it.
^ I know I heard a good spot here somewhere...

Complete2: ^ It's definitely doing something. How does it look on your side?
^ Great. Primo. Yeah. All systems as nominal as they can be in this damned Rift-storm, anyway...

b: ^ The breaker must have broken something. It's opened access to level 3.
^ So I could go down and explore if I wanted to.
^ That would...not strictly be according to protocol.
^ Something might still be broken down here. Right? We should check it out.
^ I bet the breaker is the one I saw in the other room.
^ Usually the breakers are on the other side of the level.
^ Everything okay down there? I could barely hear you earlier.
^ Yeah I’m fine, the signal just crapped out. I had to wander around for a bit to find a good reception.
^ Make sense. These old research stations are built like tanks. The hull is pretty thick, so that’s probably our culprit.
^ Probably right, I’ll try not to wander too far.
^ So remind me...what am I looking for down here.
^ We need to establish direct access to the Station mainframe. There should be a console in the back somewhere. Take a look.
^ If that’s a bust though, we’ll have to use the elevator and try the second floor.
^ And if you need anything, I’m just a call away. Max out!
^ Hey, we agreed! No more stupid sign-off phrases.
^ Going down to level two to get me plugged in?
^ Coming back topside? Come on, Stevie.
^ Forgot what you were supposed to do? Find me that computer, Stevie.
^ There's no voice, Stevie. Just come up.

Talk: ^ Gah, stupid radio is fritzing again. Max! Can you hear me?
^ We’re still down here ....*skrrrr* … Come and find us. <zzt>
^ Did you say you needed help with something?
^ What? No. No way! There’s no one down there, hasn’t been for years.
^ And yet we both heard it!
^ No, I don’t know what I heard. Look just come back up, the system is going through a diagnostic. There’s nothing more we can do.
^ I was probably just a phantom recording, an old beacon from the war.
^ But it sounded so real. She ...sounded so real.
^ Shouldn’t we check though, just in case?
^ That level access head office granted, how far does it go?

b: ^ But you’re in the system now. You can open up the others, can’t you?
^ Not a chance. Besides, they locked these places up for a reason.

Talk: ^ Let's finish what we came here to do. It's not like we can even go further down right now anyway.
